oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christopher Ammons with Private Smith (Smitty)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons with Pvt. Smith (Smitty), a 35-year-old veteran of the Korean War who volunteered for Vietnam. The faces of the two soldiers are complete but the picture, which was probably torn from a photo-booth strip, has jagged edges at top and bottom.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Portraits
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam.
